info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 27 at 5:09AM EDT until September 27 at 7:00AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of north central North Carolina, including the following county, Caswell and south central Virginia, including the following independent city, City of Danville.
* WHEN...Until 700 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 507 AM EDT, rainfall totals of 3 inches or more were observed in the City of Danville earlier this morning, with most of it falling over a short period of time. Area creeks and streams will remain elevated through 7 AM as the runoff from this rainfall continues to flow down these waterways.
- This includes the following streams and drainages... Cane Creek, Hogans Creek, Lawless Creek, Little Fall Creek, Moon Creek, Pumpkin Creek, Dan River and Sandy Creek.
- Some locations that will experience flooding include... Danville... Gatewood... Westover Hills...
- For flooding safety information, please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on X.
